image.altText: A woman signing Auslan in front of a colourful flag with a lit up stage in the distance

props.synopsis: While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts.

title.children: Why interpreting live music through Auslan is about more than just lyrics

image.altText: Ben Keays

props.synopsis: The AFL fines Ben Keays and Josh Rachele after the two Adelaide players repeatedly ignored directions to not wear metal studs on their boots.

title.children: Crows players fined after ignoring directions to not wear metal studs

image.altText: Dad of patient looks through an octogon shape beaming at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

title.children: This beautiful performance takes place at the end of a hospital bed

image.altText: Two cars parked outside a building with sign 'Little Shining Stars Early Learning Centre', a parent walks out of glass doors

props.synopsis: Parents at an Adelaide early learning centre under investigation have shared mixed views, as data reveals a number of centres have failed to comply with national laws since June.

title.children: Parents of Klemzig early learning centre speak out amid investigation

image.altText: a man and woman smile at the camera with their arm around each other whilst holding rowing ores and kayak paddles in other hand

props.synopsis: After four months of dust storms and chilblains, Anja Wever and Cy Wever-Jetis say giving up was never an option.

title.children: Mother-son duo first to travel entire 2,500km of Murray River

image.altText: chad Cornes announce retirements

props.synopsis: The club has told the 45-year-old assistant coach he won't be returning for the 2026 AFL season.

title.children: Former Premiership player Chad Cornes let go by Port Adelaide

image.altText: South Australia Livestock Exchange 2025-06-03 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Australia's sheep flock continues to decrease due to drought, with ewe numbers expected to drop 9 per cent over the next year.

title.children: Record lamb prices continue as Australian sheep flock shrinks further

image.altText: Willie Rioli walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Willie Rioli speaks candidly about a tumultuous couple of months he endured this season, admitting he spoke to his manager on multiple occasions about retiring from the AFL.

title.children: Rioli considered retiring as racism and off-field drama became 'a bit too much'

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: South Australian commercial fishers can apply to have licence and other government fees waived if their catches have been impacted by the state's toxic algal bloom, which has now spread to the Port River.

title.children: Fishing sector to have fees waived amid algal bloom, which has now spread to Port River

image.altText: A couple pose in front of a brick home featuring solar panels on its roof in daylight

props.synopsis: SA Power Networks has begun collecting an "export tariff" from energy retailers at the same time as many solar customers saw a reduction in their feed-in tariffs. But it remains to be seen how, or if, the new export charge will be passed on to consumers.

title.children: Falling feed-ins and new export tariff frustrate solar customers

image.altText: a submarine ship in the ocean

props.synopsis: The UK's top AUKUS envoy has backed Australia's "massive" contributions to the defence technology pact.

title.children: 'Enormous value': UK's top AUKUS  envoy insists the pact delivers for the US

image.altText: Abhishek Shukla wears glasses as he sits in an empty room and takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: An Australian academic who made a film about the dark side of social media manipulation has been arrested by Indian police over allegations he fleeced a divorced woman.

title.children: Australian man accused of fleecing woman of $645k in alleged marriage scam

image.altText: a firefighter battles a blaze

props.synopsis: Russia has fired a record 728 drones at Ukraine, hours after US President Donald Trump aimed unusually sharp criticism at Russia's president.

title.children: Russia fires record drone attack at Ukraine after Trump criticises Putin

image.altText: a graphic of Grok

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence firm has deleted "inappropriate" antisemitic and pro-Hitler Grok posts, as Türkiye and Poland cracked down on the chatbot for offensive comments.

title.children: Musk's AI firm deletes Grok posts praising Hitler as X chief executive resigns

image.altText: A CCTV camera attached to a wall.

props.synopsis: There's a crisis of trust in childcare but experts say the answer is to increase staffing and training.

title.children: Some childcare centres 'can't be bothered' turning on the CCTV, insiders reveal

image.altText: Donald Trump stands on stage in front of American flags, holding a large board with a list on it.

props.synopsis: The US president's tariff regime has up-ended global markets, disrupted businesses and thrown international trade into uncertainty and today's deadline is unlikely to put an end to it.

title.children: Trump's plan 'backfired' on tariffs, experts say. He's only got two deals to show for it

image.altText: Jillian Segal

props.synopsis: A sweeping plan to defeat antisemitism by the government's hand-picked envoy Jillian Segal is expected to be released to government today, with recommendations that would require new legislation to enact, as well as longer-term aims to improve understanding of Jewish culture.

title.children: Sweeping antisemitism plan expected to be handed down

image.altText: A koala moves along the ground with a black and red cube, about the size of its nose, attached below its chin.

props.synopsis: Koalas spend 20 hours a day sleeping, and most of the rest eating. But a new study focuses on a tiny fraction of the day when they're at their most vulnerable.

title.children: Koalas spend just a few minutes risking their lives on the ground each day

image.altText: Christian Horner, a caucasian male with stubble, on an F1 pitwall staring to the side.

props.synopsis: Red Bull has sacked team principal Christian Horner after 20 years in the position, the Formula 1 team has announced.

title.children: Red Bull sacks team principal Christian Horner with 'immediate effect'

image.altText: Parts of an Air India plane that crashedare seen on top of a building near trees with snapped branches.

props.synopsis: A preliminary report into the deadly crash of an Air India jetliner in June is expected to be released this week, focused on the jet's fuel switches.

title.children: Air India crash investigators to focus on fuel switches in early report

image.altText: Iga Swiatek  celebrates winning her Wimbledon quarterfinal.

props.synopsis: Former world number one Iga Świątek achieves a career first at the All-England Club as she sets up a semifinal date with unseeded Swiss Belinda Bencic.

title.children: Świątek reaches first Wimbledon semi and Bencic snaps Swiss drought

image.altText: A man walks through a smouldering plane wreckage

props.synopsis: Among the 298 passengers and crew on board the Malaysia Airlines flight were 38 Australian residents and citizens.

title.children: Europe's top court rules Russia responsible for downing MH17

image.altText: Selfie shot of woman lying on grass, wearing white tshirt. She has brown hair and a necklace.

props.synopsis: The WA Police major crime squad has been called in to help the search for 26-year-old Carolina Wilga in the Wheatbelt.

title.children: Search intensifies for German backpacker missing for more than a week

image.altText: A man wearing a red cross shirt hand a bottle of water to a woman who is in a line.

props.synopsis: A study has found around 2,300 people have died due to heat-related causes after a severe heatwave hit Europe last week.

title.children: European heatwave caused 2,300 deaths, rapid scientific analysis says

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser says Australia needs a new "Golden Age" of economic thinking to solve the acute problems hitting our economy.

title.children: RBA expects Trump's tariffs to have 'profound' effect, but markets 'shrug and move on'

image.altText: concrete bridge suspended above river with section missing with people underneath in boats

props.synopsis: At least nine people were killed after a bridge over a river collapsed in India's western Gujarat state, which has received heavy rains in recent days.

title.children: At least nine dead after bridge collapse in Gujarat state in western India

image.altText: A closeup shot of a stovetop gas ring burning bright blue with a flicker of orange against a black background

props.synopsis: Authorities warn homeowners to have regular safety checks on gas appliances after a house fire started by a suspected LPG explosion fatally injured an elderly northern NSW man.

title.children: Warnings over 'catastrophic' gas leaks after home blast kills 85yo

image.altText: Garry Ringrosecelebrates with teammate Jamison Gibson-Park

props.synopsis: A full-strength British and Irish Lions have maintained their unbeaten run in Australia, with a 36-24 win over the ACT Brumbies.

title.children: Injury worries grow for Lions during win over resilient Brumbies

image.altText: Woman who lost arm during lion attack

props.synopsis: A woman who lost an arm but survived a lion attack at a Queensland zoo is identified by her family as Forbes teacher Joanne Cabban.

title.children: NSW school teacher named as Darling Downs Zoo lion attack victim

image.altText: a photo peering into an empty courtroom

props.synopsis: A former Northern Territory judge is facing accusations of sexual harassment from a former associate, who claims he suggested they go to a concert together and "share a bed to save money".

title.children: Former judge proposed sharing a bed with associate, complaint claims

image.altText: An email reads: "1 new myGov notification. 1 new Secure message(s). To Review please click on the View message button below

props.synopsis: Scammers are poised to capitalise on the eagerness and financial anxiety of Australians during tax time. Here's how to keep your information safe.

title.children: Received messages claiming to be from the ATO or myGov? It could be a scam

image.altText: Police and workers in high-vis stand near a garbage truck on the side of a suburban street.

props.synopsis: The 85-year-old was declared dead at the scene in Townsville. Multiple agencies are investigating the incident.

title.children: Elderly woman dies after being hit by garbage truck

image.altText: Alleged murder victim Will Swinbourne smiling and drinking from a glass.

props.synopsis: Two men accused over the stabbing death of a 21-year-old during an alleged drug deal gone wrong on the Gold Coast have been ordered to stand trial in Brisbane.

title.children: 'Horrifying scream' during alleged car park murder, witness tells

image.altText: A woman points a cloth tapestry

props.synopsis: Officials said on Tuesday that the treasured medieval tapestry will be on loan from France and arrive next year at the British Museum.

title.children: 'One of the most iconic pieces of art' to return to England after almost 1,000 years
